tweets.html:
Also when I'm billionaire mayor you won't be allowed to screen any movie that pretends Toronto is New York because come on

— slackbot (@pareene) May 31, 2012

"Black Swan" is on. I challenge 1 of you to recut this into a short comedy bout a woman who always gets interrupted while masturbating.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) May 31, 2012

Maybe "Here Comes Honey Boo Boo" is the "Cougar Town" of TLC Shows That Sound Awful But are Brilliant. Probably not.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 31, 2012

TBS has announced a new title for Cougar Town: Honey Boo Boo Town. Dan Byrd's character will now be played by Ms. Boo Boo. Dont tell Dan.

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) May 31, 2012

Oh, Christ. Thanks TLC. I'll be saying the title "Here Comes Honey Boo Boo" all day, perhaps even to strangers walking toward me.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) May 31, 2012

I'm reminded by a follower that TLC missed its chance to call the show "Honey Boo Boo Doesn't Give A Shit." Another fail, TLC.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) May 31, 2012

I hope one day one of the Toddlers and Tiaras girls grows up to be on the National Spelling Bee.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) May 31, 2012

Idea for a sitcom: The guy who ate a guyâ€™s face off and the guy who threw his intestines at police teach at a performing arts high school.

— MÎ±tt ThomÎ±s (@mattthomas) May 31, 2012

My performance as "guy pretending to be on phone avoiding eye contact w/ aggressive homeless guy," is getting some early Oscar buzz.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) May 31, 2012

Obama on unveiling of G.W.& Laura Bush portrait at WH: "You also left me a really good TV sports package. I use it."

— Roger Simon (@politicoroger) May 31, 2012

I enjoy Facebook and all, but sometimes I miss calling each of my friends and asking if they like the newspaper articles I've been reading.

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) May 31, 2012

Apparently the John Edwards grand jury just mistakenly indicted Will Gardner.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) May 31, 2012

Watching live feed of reporters running out of the courtroom is a compelling argument for reporters running more regularly.

— On a Merry coXmas (@anamariecox) May 31, 2012

I want jurors to sit with their backs to Edwards, then hit a button and spin around when they've decided he's guilty.

— Nick Rizzo (@nickrizzo) May 31, 2012

MSNBC anchor: "Can you explain what's happened?" Pete Williams: "No." #petewilliamslove

— On a Merry coXmas (@anamariecox) May 31, 2012

The Edwards jury now has to unanimously decide if Joan's decision on #madmen the other night was true to her character.

— Patrick Condon (@patricktcondon) May 31, 2012

"Our reporter has been following this story very closely." Once I'd like to hear: "has been half-heartedly monitoring during coffee breaks."

— Will Dixon (@wcdixon) May 31, 2012

This Was TV on May 31, 1990: Seinfeld aired its first episode of Season 1. The show's initial 4-episode order is the smallest in TV history.

— This Was Television (@ThisWasTV) May 31, 2012

@ThisWasTV Not that there's anything wrong with that.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) May 31, 2012

The longer Andy and Ellie go without getting a divorce the more depressed I get watching Cougar Town.

— Muffin MacGuffinðŸ•¯ (@MuffMacGuff) May 31, 2012

Every day TNT doesn't introduce a "Rizzolli & Bash" online dating site is a day wasted.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) May 31, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
In retrospect, I kind of wish Mad Men had saved Dennis Haskins to play the Jaguar guy this past weekend.

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) May 31, 2012

Talking to your 14 year old daughters about how their bodies are changing is a great way to get your TV room back.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) May 31, 2012

People on True Blood say "fucking" too much.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) May 31, 2012

@emilynussbaum It's almost like there's aspects of the show that are entirely gratuitous.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) May 31, 2012

Lauer closes Nightly News w/ (Freudian?) slip: "I'll see you tomorrow morning on Tonight...on Today, excuse me." HE"S COMING FOR YOU, LENO!

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) May 31, 2012

Can I officially call for a moratorium on single-camera comedies' use of the cutaway whooshing noise? Please?

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) May 31, 2012

Watching the first episode of "The Staircase," about prosecuting Michael Peterson for his wife's murder. Ladies: stop marrying Petersons!

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 1, 2012

@televisionary It's going to be very very very hard to choose this year's worst pilot.

— MariaElena Fernandez (@writerchica) June 1, 2012

The field is pretty much wide open. RT @writerchica: @televisionary It's going to be very very very hard to choose this year's worst pilot.

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) June 1, 2012

I wonder how previous Spelling Bee runners-up feel about Breaking Bad's Tio.

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) June 1, 2012

I just said Wilford Brimley when I MEANT Bradford Whitley. Think about that.

— Paul Smith (@Haunt1013) June 1, 2012

Spelling bee fact: German words are tricky.

— mesk (@_mesk) June 1, 2012

"Can you spell... MY DICK? Ha! You probably can, nerdbag; anyway that's an example of how normal people interact."

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) June 1, 2012

Helicopters are overhead and facebook is down. So begins the hardest boner of Roland Emmerich's life.

— (((Tom Kauffman))) (@TomKauffman) June 1, 2012

Every generation identifies with its own actor playing #FartCop . For me, he's James Spader. Young people today, he's @iJesseWilliams .

— John Moe (@johnmoe) June 1, 2012

Randomly stumbled into Mork & Mindy. As a kid, I had a picture of Mork on my wall. Also, I owned actual rainbow suspenders.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) June 1, 2012

Let's just put it this way: I was not a young Carrie Bradshaw.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) June 1, 2012

NO DON'T DO IT! RT @OMGFacts Adam Sandler and Rob Schneider have appeared in at least 18 different movies together! Check out some of them.

— Ken Pisani (@kpsmartypants) June 1, 2012

Welp, finished FNL. Every human should be required to watch the last 10 minutes. What a journey. #tears

— Scott Hagan (@scotthagan) June 1, 2012

Wish John Malkovich and Siri would just get a room. They're creeping me out.

— Paul Sullivan (@PWSullivan) June 1, 2012

Anson Williams was the Paul Rudd of his day.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) June 1, 2012

"From the Producer of HALF NELSON and BLUE VALENTINE." So, a bubbly and uplifting tale, then.

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) June 1, 2012

That's a lot of Scolari. #girlscatchup

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) June 1, 2012

@NoelMu It is, dare I say, the full Scolari.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) June 1, 2012

XBox when I pay for Gold I expect not to see Daniel Tosh's face on my dashboard, what the hell, we had a deal

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) June 1, 2012

I turned out pretty well considering TV was black and white when I was a kid. I've never even murdered anyone!

— Robin McCauley Lynch (@RobinMcCauley) June 1, 2012

Well this is shameless. But Emmy people, please remember that Men of a Certain Age is eligible. Last batch of episodes, some of our best.

— Mike Royce (@MikeRoyce) June 1, 2012

Kelly Clarkson remains endlessly charming. Still not sure how the heck the show works though. #Duets

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) June 1, 2012

Wow. So this is what Duets is like? (shoots television, runs off into the night)

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) June 1, 2012

On one hand, they DID explain the rules at the top of tonight's #Duets. On the other hand, no one goes home again tonight.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) June 1, 2012

Scripps Spelling Bee > > > > > > > > > > > Duets

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) June 1, 2012

#Duets could be the worst reality show in the world but I'll take weekly Kelly Clarkson performances however I can get them.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 1, 2012

I wish Robin Thicke's shirt had sleeves. For my soul. #Duets

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 1, 2012

The issue: You could be the best singer in the world but then Kelly Clarkson starts singing and you sound like a bag of garbage. #Duets

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 1, 2012

Next week on #Duets, someone is going home. How will they be eliminated? WHO KNOWS? It's like a singing show and a mystery show all in one.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 1, 2012

@TVandDinners created by Veena Suud

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) June 1, 2012

"Until we go live in Week 6" - wait, they're not going live for until WEEK SIX?! #TurnsOutIDidRecordDuetsAfterAll

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) June 1, 2012

@Memles This show needs a worldwide format summit.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 1, 2012

@TVandDinners This implies any part of the world would desire to format this.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) June 1, 2012

@Memles Week six?! I missed that part, having gone to watch dust motes with the cats. Week six?!?

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) June 1, 2012

Siri groom some of the beards on Hatfields & McCoys

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) June 1, 2012

How many nieces and nephews does Jessica Fletcher have? Her siblings were whores.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 1, 2012

And what was Jessica Fletcher's yearly hotel budget? She must have sold a hundred million books.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 1, 2012

How can the sequel to "Rise Of The Planet Of The Apes" be "Dawn Of The Planet Of The Apes"? How slowly are we moving through this day?

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 1, 2012

@nprmonkeysee It should at least be "Breakfast of the Planet of the Apes" by now.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) June 1, 2012
